clinical_study.official_title: Dementia Pain Management Knowledge Scale Development and Impact of an Educational Program on Hospital Nurses' Knowledge Evaluation

lead_sponsor.agency: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to develop and test a scale for exploring hospital nurses' knowledge about dementia pain and dementia pain management.

detailed_description.textblock: The researcher recruited 285 nurses from three hospitals, and divided them into the experimental group and the comparison group. The experimental group took two-hour online course about dementia pain care in two weeks. The comparison group took two-hour online course about dementia care in two weeks. The nurses performed a post-test after the two-week course immediately; two weeks later, the second post-test was performed again.

primary_outcome.measure: score of Dementia Pain Management Knowledge Scale
primary_outcome.description: Testing nurses' Dementia Pain Management Knowledge. The minimum value of this scale is 15, and the maximum value is 0. Higher scores mean having better Dementia Pain Management Knowledge.

secondary_outcome.description: Testing nurses' Dementia Care Knowledge. The minimum value of thus scale is 16, and the maximum value is 0. Higher scores mean having better Dementia Care Knowledge.

secondary_outcome.measure: score of the Chinese version of the Knowledge and Beliefs About Pain in Elderly Patients With Dementia (KBPED-C) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Testing nurses' Knowledge and Beliefs About Pain in Elderly Patients With Dementia. The minimum value of this scale is 85, and the maximum value is 17. Higher scores mean having better Knowledge and Beliefs About Pain in Elderly Patients With Dementia.
